intro: Sidasodes colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian sida, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
